<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Delete a collection. As example, used with a soldier, it'll hide the ingame model.

''When targetting ArmA 2 1.06 or newer, use [[hideObject]] instead. This function is a relic from dynamic building destruction development. It is left only for compatibility with scripts created before ArmA 2 1.06, and its functionality may be changed or removed in the future.''</value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''deleteCollection''' object</value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name/>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[deleteCollection]] unitName; </code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value>[[hideObject]], [[hideObjectGlobal]], [[isObjectHidden]]  </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>
